intro: Tarasa martiniana, commonly known as the Martin's tarasa, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep pink. Its leaves are broad and velvety, often with a slight pubescence. Tarasa martiniana is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks.
